page.title: 08The School.
page.content: We go to Tollesbury County Primary School. It first opened on the 6th of April 1896. At that time there were two separate schools, one for boys, which is across the main road, called the Masonic Hall, and the girls and infants came to the school we are in now. The Headmistress for the infants was Mrs Henrietta Billing and the Headmistress for the girls was Miss C.M. Thomas. Today our Headmaster is Mr. Brodie. The number of children is about 280, but this varies when children leave or come. The school has grown rapidly, we have ten classes, and we are having a new school, joined on with four more classrooms. The sports field is about 2 acres and can fit 3 rounders pitches on it. We have a high jump, two long jump pitches and a race track.
